title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 50.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 50.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms when used in this Chapter shall be deemed
to mean and include: (a) Navigation

Law. The Navigation Law of the State of New York. (b) Board. The Board of Commissioners of

Pilots. (c) Commissioners. The
commissioners of pilots holding office as members of the Board of Commissioners
of Pilots pursuant to article 6 of the Navigation Law. (d) Secretary. The secretary of the Board of

Commissioners of Pilots. (e) Sandy

Hook pilot shall mean a person licensed in accordance with State law to pilot
ships in the Port of New York and the ports of New Jersey. (f) Hudson River pilot. A pilot licensed by
the commissioners under section
91-a
of the

Navigation Law, or a full branch Hudson River pilot licensed by the
commissioners as required by act of the Legislature of the State of New

York. (g) Long Island Sound-Block

Island Sound pilot. A pilot licensed by the commissioners under section
91-b
of the

Navigation Law, or a full branch Long Island Sound-Block Island Sound pilot
licensed by the commissioners as required by act of the Legislature of the

State of New York. (h) Sandy Hook
pilot apprentice shall mean a person duly registered with the commissioners in
accord with these regulations and actively serving the apprenticeship
prerequisite to admission to the Sandy Hook pilot licensing
examination. (i) Pilot in training. An experienced pilot completing passages to extend a State of New York pilot
license or a pilot not licensed by the State of New York but who has been
selected by the commissioners as a pilot in training for the State
license. (j) Pilotage or piloting
shall mean the boarding of a vessel for the purpose of advising the ship's
master to safely conduct it over or through the waters of New York. (k) Sandy Hook Pilots' Association shall mean
and include the United New Jersey Sandy Hook Pilots' Benevolent Association, the United New Jersey Sandy Hook Pilots' Association, the United New York Sandy

Hook Pilots' Benevolent Association and the United New York Sandy Hook Pilots'
Association. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
50.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
